result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice W. Underwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
---------------------------------------
Pay restitution if any is claimed. Restitution is held open for 60 days and is subject to defendant's right to challenge.

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 01/02/2017 and WITHOUT work release privileges. Can be served in Illinois if approved bye DOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice W. Underwood

records.addlTxt: Discharge Certificate from Department of Corrections

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Application for Jail Time Credit form

2:33 pm  Court in session.  Case Called.  Appearances given.  
DDA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Maurice W. Underwood in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court recites charge and maximum potential penalties. 
Attorney Johnson makes record with regard to victim notification
Atty May has reviewed the PSI with Mr. Underwood and there are no additions or corrections.  
2:37 pm  Statement by Calvin Lemons on behalf of Mr. Underwood.  
2:43 pm  Statement by Elaine Underwood, Mother of defendant.  
2:45 pm  Statement by Sakeena Terry, friend of the family.   
2:46 pm  Atty Johnson confirms that the plea agreement is that the State is not making a specific recommendation as to sentence but will provide the Court with relevant information.  Atty Johnson makes record.  
2:51 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty May.  
2:56 pm  Mr. Underwood has nothing further to say.  The Court advises that the Court has read his letter.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

WITHHELD SENTENCE - 2 years probation;  
3 days dead time credit if revoked;  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
1)  One (1) week in Jail WITHOUT work release to commence on or before January 2, 2017.  Can be served in Illinois if approved by DOC.  
2)  Obtain G.E.D.  
3)  Obtain / maintain employment.  
4)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
5)  Pay restitution if any is claimed.  Restitution is held open for 60 days and is subject to the defendant's right to challenge.  
6)  Comply with counseling as deemed appropriate by Agent.  
7)  Provided DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

Court warns defendant:  1)  He may not possess a firearm; 2)  He may not vote until his civil rights are restored.  
3:09 pm  Court in recess.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Maurice W. Underwood in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Maurice W. Underwood in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Maurice W. Underwood in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Motion deadline 04-25-16. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Maurice W. Underwood appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Maurice Underwood present in court, in custody via video with attorney Julia May for bond purposes only. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by attorney May denied. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH THE COVE IN LAKE GENEVA OR ITS EMPLOYEES. NO CONTACT WITH S.K. OR HIS RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
